shard_namespace_UPPER_description: The Biosecurity Animal Name Index ({{ shard_namespace_UPPER }}) is a tool for the biosecurity community that deals with animal names and their usage in the scientific literature, whether as a current name or synonym, for ICZN-named organisms that are NOT native to, nor naturalised in Australia. {{ shard_namespace_UPPER }} does not recommend any particular taxonomy or nomenclature. For a listing of currently accepted scientific names for ex-Australia animal organisms, please use the Biosecurity Animal Checklist ({{ taxonomy_name }}) link above.
taxonomy_name_description: The Biosecurity Animal Checklist ({{ taxonomy_name }}) is a working taxonomy for use by biosecurity specialists in Australia.
description_html: This section of the National ex-Australia Species List infrastructure delivers names and taxonomies for organisms named according to the International Code of Zoological Nomenclature. The data comprise names, bibliographic information, and taxonomic concepts for organisms that are neither native to nor naturalised in Australia. The Biosecurity Animal Name Index ({{ shard_namespace_UPPER }}) provides names and bibliographic information. The Biosecurity Animal Checklist ({{ taxonomy_name }}) provides a provisional taxonomy.
